revised_title: Starlings and Foot-and-Mouth Disease: A Possible Connection
tldr: This study investigates the possible connection between the starling bird and the occurrence of unexplained outbreaks of foot-and-mouth disease in the British Isles. The starling is found to be the only common bird species closely associated with cattle, and its migration patterns and distribution show striking correlations with the incidence of the disease. The author suggests that starlings may act as carriers of the disease, transmitting it through mechanical means such as contaminated feet or feathers.
